events.name: Global Digital Conference - Better Code, Faster. Let's solve it.
events.description:
How Developer Productivity Powers Business Impact
Build dynamic apps at the speed that customers need. Join experts and innovators to learn how to build quality code faster with CI/CD and serverless.

This is an online conference and is basically a preview for the Cloud Study Jams that will be announced soon.

When you RSVP you will receive a link and upon landing on the event page, you will log in with your Google account, and then register for the event, using credentials of your choosing. Once registered, you should receive a confirmation message, and also be able to access content via the event landing page.

This is not hosted directly by GDG Silicon Beach but, as mentioned above,
we will be announcing the Cloud Study Jams very soon and we will finally meet in person at a venue! We hope this conference is informative. Watch for the Cloud Study Jam announcement and until then, we're looking forward to seeing you!

Schedule:

7:15 PM PST APAC Preshow
Han Wen Kam, Jalilah Halim

7:30 PM PST APAC Keynote - Better code, faster
Pali Bhat, Miles Ward, Brendan Aye

8:15 PM PST Choose your track :
SERVERLESS - BUILD AND SHIP APPLICATIONS FASTER
or
CI/CD - SPEED WITH RELIABILITY

11:15 PM PST Study Jams Online: Kubernetes Qwik Start lab
Kunal Bhatia

12:00 AM PST
APAC Closing Message
Han Wen Kam, Jalilah Halim

** Note: this presented for Asia Pacific region but the Americas version was at 9am this morning so this seemed like a more accessible schedule.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam: Kubernetes West
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be in Room 4H. Bring a photo ID and scan it at the guest registration tablets at the front desk when you arrive at WeWork for the event. If your photo ID does not successfully scan, check in at the tablet as a guest of "Meetup Event".

events.name: Cloud Study Jam: Machine Learning
events.description:

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.
events.how_to_find_us: CRASHSPACE - A Los Angeles Hackerspace, is basically a bungalow on the south side of Venice just west of Motor ave.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam: Machine Learning Replay & Part 2
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Already joined at our last Jam and want to start the next quest? Then join us for our next Cloud Study Jam: Machine Learning!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console & Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Street parking should be available on Westlawn and/or Beatrice and last time someone successfully parked in the garage, but I believe it is expensive.

If we end up with a wait list, I'll look into getting a second room at WeWork and failing that I'll attempt to set up a Hangouts Meeting so that waitlisters can attend online.

Also let me know asap if there's a different study jam anyone would like to review. This is our last chance at these free month qwiklabs so if people would prefer Kubernetes or IoT or Security, let me know. If there's enough demand I'll look at getting codes for those or changing this MeetUp to something other than Machine Learning.

Looking forward to seeing everyone!
events.how_to_find_us: We're in Room 4H. Please also bring a photo ID, scan it at the guest registration tablets at the front desk and check in as a guest of Christopher Turnbull when you arrive. If your ID does not successfully scan, check in as a guest of "Meetup Event".

events.name: I/O Extended 2019 Silicon Beach
events.description:
Welcome to I/O Extended 2019! Join us for some replay content of the Google I/O conference as well as some live talks and prizes!

Agenda:
6:00pm: Check-in and mingle
6:30pm: Google I/O '19 Highlights
7:00pm: Focus on your code, not infrastructure - Martin & Zoë Omander
7:45pm: Sara Robinson - An AI Platform Demonstration
9:00pm: Q & A, Survey and Giveaway

OUR FEATURED SPEAKERS:
Martin Omander (martinomander.com):
Martin works for Google in Mountain View, California. His job in the Developer Relations team is to help developers build better software, and improve Google's Cloud Platform to make it even better for that purpose. In his spare time he manages to sneak in some game programming. Before Google, Martin worked at string of startups in Silicon Valley as a software engineer.

Zoë Omander:
Zoë is an online middle school student and YouTuber who plays the guitar and ukelele. She is also Martin's daughter.

Sara Robinson (@SRobTweets):
Sara is a Developer Advocate on Google's Cloud Platform team, focusing on machine learning. She inspires developers and data scientists to integrate ML into their applications through demos, online content, and events. Sara has a bachelor’s degree from Brandeis University. Before Google, she was a Developer Advocate on the Firebase team. When she's not programming she can be found on a spin bike, listening to the Hamilton soundtrack, or eating froyo.
events.how_to_find_us:
4th floor at WeWork.

There should be plenty of street parking on Westlawn and/or Beatrice (the street behind the building parallel to Jefferson). Otherwise, Cinemark, a short walk away, validates (no questions asked) for 4 hours.

events.name: TensorFlow Doc Sprint - BEGINNERS WELCOME!
events.description:
What is a doc sprint?

A doc sprint is a way to improve the documentation for an open-source library.

We are organizing TensorFlow docs sprint to improve TensorFlow 2.0’s documentation.

You DON'T even have to be a TensorFlow EXPERT! If you have good English reading and writing skills YOU CAN participate!

There are two ways to get involved:

- Checking existing TF 2.0 API symbol documentation quality, and filing
an issue in GitHub if it is in any way incomplete.

- Taking ownership of an API symbol with poor documentation quality,
and either modifying its docstring or its corresponding markdown file.

Be sure to bring a laptop and your learning hat!
events.how_to_find_us: My very close friends have kindly agreed to allow us to meet at their house! It's a beautiful private residence, so please be extra respectful. There's ample parking, especially on Saturdays.

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere GDG Silicon Beach
events.description:
Want to get started with Kotlin, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Kotlin/Everywhere event.

We are so fortunate to have Meghan Mehta and Caren Chang joining us from Google to give intro to Kotlin talks and to help guide us through a hands on Kotlin/Everywhere CodeLab about refactoring Java to Kotlin.

AGENDA:

6:30pm - 6:55pm - Arrive, mingle, eat pizza and network
7:00pm - 7:25pm - Meghan Mehta - Why Kotlin
7:30pm - 7:55pm - Caren Chang - Help Kotlin Help You
8:00pm - 8:55pm - Refactoring Java to Kotlin Codelab
or
8:00pm - 8:55pm - Member Feedback Session
8:55pm - End - Survey and swag giveaway (Past prizes have included: Google Home Minis, Google Cloud Hub, Chromecasts, Unique Google apparel and more!)

If you intend to participate in the CodeLab remember to bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook). The lab will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Chrome or Firefox installed. Don’t forget your charger!

If you are not planning to participate in the lab, we will use this time to get feedback from you, our members, about what kind of content you would like to see in the future.
events.how_to_find_us: Free street parking should be available on Westlawn and Beatrice, but there is also an underground lot for a fee. In a pinch you can park at the Runway mall and validate for 4 hours at Cinemark (they don't ask questions). It's a 5min walk from there.

events.name: GDG DevFest Greater LA 2019
events.description:
GDG DevFest LA 2019 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more! This is a collaboration of all the GDG chapters in the Los Angeles area and we're hoping to make it a big one!

Please buy a ticket for each person as well after RSVPing: https://devfest19la.eventbrite.com

This event is cross posted in other GDG LA area meetups. Feel free to only RSVP for one of them.

events.name: GDG: Building for the Next Billion
events.description:
What: GDG Silicon Beach (Google Development Group) presents: Building for the Next Billion
Where: Tala HQ[masked]th St, Santa Monica, CA 90404
When: November 6th 6-9pm
Food and Drink: Pizza, Beer, Wine, and Water

Schedule:
6-6:30 Check-in/Networking
6:30-6:35 GDG welcome by Nicole/James
6:35-6:45 Tala/Speaker Intro Shivani Siroya
6:45-7:05 Chris Schmitz Mobile Engineering Manager-Tala
7:05-7:25 Emerson Serra, Global DevOps Manager-Tala
7:25-7:35 Break
7:40- 7:50 Panel Moderated Portion
7:50-8:00 Panel Pre-submitted questions
8:00-8:15 Panel free-form questions
8:15-8:45 Networking/Wrap-up
9:00-close Optional Post Event Happy Hour at Sonny McLean's (4 blocks away)

If you would like to presubmit questions for our expert panel please do so here: https://forms.gle/exg2q4ju2DVpHar66

Tala's talk will be Lessons Learned from Building for the Next Billion Users

Tala recently celebrated its 5th year in Kenya and has continued to expand to other countries like the Philippines, Mexico, and now India. Its app regularly tops the charts of the countries it supports, disbursing over $1 billion to more than 4 million users worldwide. In this talk we’ll cover what it takes to build successful global apps and how to overcome some of the unique challenges presented by supporting different countries.

Speaker Bios

Shivani Siroya (CEO/Founder)

Shivani has had many microfinance jobs and investment banking at firms such as Citi, UBS and Credit Suisse in her name. The launch of Tala was as a result of Shivani’s qualitative research that inspired her throughout her entrepreneurial journey. She worked with UN population Fund interviewing over 3,500 people across nine different countries in sub-Saharan Africa and West Africa. During her time at UN Population Fund, she met hardworking people across the globe that could not get loans due to lack of financial identity. Shivani is a 2016 Aspen Institute Finance Leader Fellow, 2016 WEF Young Global Leader, 2015 Senior TED Fellow and 2013 Ashoka Fellow. She is also on the board of Stellar.org. She holds a M.P.H from Columbia University and a B.A. from Wesleyan University.

Chris Schmitz (Mobile Engineering Manager)

Chris has been a mobile developer/manager since 2006, focused primarily on Android, developing apps with millions of cumulative installs. Now, he oversees Android development at Tala as they continue their mission to bring financial access, choice, and control to billions of underserved people globally.

Emerson Serra (Manager, Global DevOps)

Emerson is the DevOps Manager at Tala, passionate about helping to provide financial access to the underserved across the globe using Kubernetes and DevOps practices. Prior to Tala, he worked at Ticketmaster helping ticket on-sales for high profile artists a smooth experience, also worked at Edmunds.com, Videomize and Crowdgather building highly available and reliable services on various web, mobile and cloud platforms. Originally from Guatemala, he currently lives in California.

If you would like to be a speaker or a panelist at a future event please let us know here: https://forms.gle/5Q8iMEV1B1nQjoxQ8

If you would like to host a future event please let us know here: https://forms.gle/6ieM191DEZjjsG7W8
events.how_to_find_us:
Parking available on the streets or in the lot on Pennsylvania.
Once parked,check in with security to get buzzed to 3rd floor.

events.name: Supercharge and Operationalize your Microservice with Istio and Anthos
events.description:
Craig Box will be at Google to tell us how a service mesh lets you automate and supercharge your network in the same way Kubernetes lets you automate and supercharge deploying and running software. Learn about the history of the pattern inside Google, the open-source Istio service mesh based on it, how service mesh is for more than just VMs, and why it turns out it's not complex: everyone is just holding it wrong!

Craig leads the Cloud Native advocacy team at Google Cloud. He has worked with customers and communities since the launch of Kubernetes in 2014, and has delivered talks on 6 continents, including a KubeCon keynote. He is the co-host of the Kubernetes Podcast from Google.

Vic Iglesias will be there to give his talk on building a software delivery platform with Anthos. Using Anthos and GitLab you can build a multi-team platform for streamlining CI/CD, policy management and developer onboarding across your organization and teams. This talk will walk through the reasons for building a platform in your organization and then demo common developer, operator, and security engineer tasks to show how the patterns can improve your company’s software delivery performance.
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the "The Doors", the largest event space, located in the main building. Enter at the corner of Hampton Drive and Sunset Ave. People can arrive as early as 6pm.

events.name: Google Cloud Run Club LA
events.description:
Cloud Run Club is an event for developers to learn about Cloud Run, serverless and container technologies. Attendees will meet Googlers and other community members while getting hands on with Cloud Run. The event will include tech talks, hands-on labs, an optional 5k fun-run and food and drinks.

What is Cloud Run?

Cloud Run is a managed compute platform that enables you to run stateless containers that are invocable via HTTP requests. Cloud Run is serverless: it abstracts away all infrastructure management, so you can focus on what matters most — building great applications. It is built from Knative, letting you choose to run your containers either fully managed with Cloud Run, or in your Google Kubernetes Engine cluster with Cloud Run on GKE.

**IMPORTANT**
An RSVP here does not register you for the event. To be on the guest list you must register at:
https://events.withgoogle.com/cloud-run-club-los-angeles/

Read more about Cloud Run in general at:
https://cloud.google.com/run/
events.how_to_find_us: As far as I know there is only street parking available, however, it seems to be ample. One suggestion is to park in the general area and grab an e-scooter to go the last mile... Or just walk or run? ;-)

events.name: Do you Flutter?
events.description:
Do you code in Flutter? Have you had trouble configuring it without using a Mac? You're in luck, our speaker has been working on solving that problem. Come network and meet Nevercode's new CEO.
https://blog.codemagic.io/nevercode-is-announcing-a-new-ceo/

After listening to our amazing speaker, we'll stream some of Flutter Interact which happens in New York on Dec 11th. And of course, we'll have food, drinks and some prizes! Invite your friends.

Speaker - Martin Jeret
Title: Building Flutter for iOS without a Mac
Abstract: Building for iOS is always a challenge since we might not be able to run an iOS simulator if we don't have a Mac computer and configuring your Xcode project without a Mac is a real struggle. Moreover releasing apps to the app store is painful on any device. Codemagic CI/CD has been working on a VScode plugin that allows developers to connect to a remote MacOS and run your Flutter apps on an iOS simulator. You can also use the MacOS to configure your Xcode project. We're looking forward to sharing this with the community so come check it out.
